meanings.definition: A digging or grubbing tool with a flat blade set at right angles to the handle.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used mattocks to dig up the stubborn roots in the field.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker carried mattocks to break up the hard ground.
meanings.sent3: The mattocks leaned against the shed, looking like oversized shovels.
meanings.sent4: The mattocks sliced through the soil like a sharp knife through butter.
meanings.sent5: The sound of mattocks hitting the earth echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent4: The workers mattocks the ground tirelessly under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: Mattocksing requires strength and precision to be effective.
